SENT.plain: Stroke is a leading cause of maternal death
Intracerebral hemorrhage may be associated with eclampsia, metastatic choriocarcinoma or ruptured arteriovenous malformations
Intracranial venous thrombosis may result from a hypercoagulable state or local intracranial vascular damage
Subarachnoid hemorrhage is usually caused by the rupture of an intracranial aneurysm or arteriovenous malformation
Signs and symptoms of stroke in pregnancy can be confusing
The physician must be aware of these signs to avoid mismanagement of the pregnant stroke patient
